Package spaceinvadersProject.playground

Class SpaceInvadersLevel

java.lang.Object
javashooter.playground.Playground
spaceinvadersProject.playground.SpaceInvadersLevel
public class SpaceInvadersLevel extends javashooter.playground.Playground
Class that realizes all the game logic of a SpaceInvaders-type level. This is the class that you inherit from if you want to create your own SpaceInvaders-tpe levels. Functions performed by this class are:
  • initially set up the level, spawn all object etc., in method prepareLevel(java.lang.String)
  • define a game state machine, replay initial message and detect collisions in method prepareLevel(java.lang.String)
  • create a lot of utility functions to redefine if you want to change a certain aspect of the level

    • actionIfEgoCollidesWithEnemy

      protected void actionIfEgoCollidesWithEnemy(javashooter.gameobjects.GameObject enemy, javashooter.gameobjects.GameObject ego)
      Default action that is executed whenever ego colliudes with an enemy. standard behavior: set temporary text over ego and deduct points. This text lives only for a short time. While it lives, further collisions are ignored. Otherwise a single collision would result in a lot of deducted points...

    • actionIfEgoObjectIsHit

      protected void actionIfEgoObjectIsHit(javashooter.gameobjects.GameObject eshot, javashooter.gameobjects.GameObject ego)

    • prepareLevel

      public void prepareLevel(String id)
      initially sets up the level or loads it from a savegame file. Loads resources etc. After this method, levelstatus is set to "start" if it is a fresh init, otherwise the status and the flags are taken from the savegame. resources are loaded and assigned to objects regardless of whether is it a savegame. TODO level.based resource management: if level is loaded, all object must reload external resources like sound files and animations, or else these must be stored in flags as well.
      Specified by:
      prepareLevel in class javashooter.playground.Playground
      Parameters:
      id - String identifies level.

    • redrawLevel

      public void redrawLevel(Graphics2D g2)
      (re)draws the level but NOT the objects, they draw themselves. Called by the main game loop. This method mainly draws the background and the scoreboard.
      Specified by:
      redrawLevel in class javashooter.playground.Playground
      Parameters:
      g2 - Graphics2D object that can, and should be, draw on.

    • setupInitialState

      protected void setupInitialState()
      Adds ego object and stars and displays startup message. Is called from applyGameLogic
